Description: Two fragments from shoulder of North Ionian black-figured closed pottery vessel (dinos?); inside reserved. Glaze fired brown; red details. Exterior: trace of upper frieze on A; below, between bands with added colour lines, (A) Lion walking to right behind deer; added red on lion's neck and belly; rosette fill; (B) lion wallking to left.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224, nos 105-106)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 109, pl. XXXIV, no. 320.8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.949)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5958a-b (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
